verses.text: He cried also in mine ears \add with\add* a loud voice, saying, Cause them that have charge over the city to draw near, even every man \add with\add* his destroying weapon in his hand.

And behold, six men came from the way of the higher gate, which lieth toward the north, and every man a slaughter weapon in his hand; and one man among them \add was\add* clothed \add with\add* linen, with a writer’s inkhorn by his side: and they went in, and stood beside the brasen altar.

And the glory of the God of Israel was gone up from the cherub, whereupon he was, to the threshold of the house. And he called to the man clothed \add with\add* linen, which \add had\add* the writer’s inkhorn by his side;

and the \sc Lord\sc* said unto him, Go through the midst of the city, through the midst of Jerusalem, and set a mark upon the foreheads of the men that sigh and that cry for all the abominations that be done in the midst thereof.
And to the others he said in mine hearing, Go ye after him through the city, and smite: let not your eye spare, neither have ye pity:

slay utterly old \add and\add* young, both maids, and little children, and women: but come not near any man upon whom \add is\add* the mark; and begin at my sanctuary. Then they began at the ancient men which \add were\add* before the house.
And he said unto them, Defile the house, and fill the courts \add with\add* the slain: go ye forth. And they went forth, and slew in the city.

And it came to pass, while they were slaying them, and I \add was\add* left, that I fell upon my face, and cried, and said, Ah Lord \sc God\sc*, \add wilt\add* thou destroy all the residue of Israel in thy pouring out of thy fury upon Jerusalem?

Then said he unto me, The iniquity of the house of Israel and Judah \add is\add* exceeding great, and the land is full \add of\add* blood, and the city full \add of\add* perverseness: for they say, The \sc Lord\sc* hath forsaken the earth, and the \sc Lord\sc* seeth not.
And \add as for\add* me also, mine eye shall not spare, neither will I have pity, \add but\add* I will recompense their way upon their head.
And behold, the man clothed with linen, which \add had\add* the inkhorn by his side, reported the matter, saying, I have done as thou hast commanded me.
